intro: Schizogyne obtusifolia, commonly known as the broad-leafed schizogyne, is a species of flowering plant in the family Apiaceae. It is characterized by its biennial or short-lived perennial growth habit and is native to regions of southern Africa. The plant features compound leaves with broad, ovate leaflets and produces small, greenish-yellow flowers arranged in umbels. Schizogyne obtusifolia is often found in grassy areas and along roadsides, thriving in well-drained soils. Due to its ornamental value and adaptability, it is occasionally cultivated in gardens.
